PyDataSource.AddOn.peak¶

AddOn.peak(attr=None, ichannel=None, name=None, xaxis=None, roi=None, scale=1, baseline=None, methods=None, threshold=None, docs={}, units={})[source]¶

Simple 1D peak locator.

Parameters:
  • attr (str) – Name of data object on which to find peaks
  • ichannel (int) – If not present, peak locators will be created for all chanels [Note: acqiris waveform default names start with ch1 following AMI convention]
  • name (str) – Name of peak object [Default is to append ‘_peak’ and sequential number to input attr name.
  • xaxis (array_like) – X-axis coordinate of data object Default is to use wftime for attr=’waveform’
  • threshold (float) – Peak threshold. default threshold is 1.5% of full range for Acqiris
  • baseline (float) – Baseline level to subtract
  • scale (float) – Peak scale factor
  • method (str) – Peak finding method options include: ‘index’: index at max channel. ‘max’: maximum value.
  • roi (tuple, optional) – Region of interest
  • docs (dict) – Doc strings for resulting peaks
  • units (dict) – Units of peaks data [Default assumes same as attr data]
